title: Calories in Sirloin Steak
meta_description: Learn calories in steak sirloin per 100g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition details for easy tracking.
assumptions: Lean top sirloin steak, cooked (broiled or grilled), trimmed of visible fat, no added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and source; check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked sirloin steak offers ~206 kcal and ~31 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in steak sirloin per 100g?
faqs.a: About 206 kcal for lean, cooked sirloin steak per 100g.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in sirloin steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 31 g of protein per 100g serving.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked sirloin steak.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a sirloin steak?
faqs.a: Around 8.2 g total fat, including 3.2 g saturated, per 100g.

faqs.q: Is sirloin steak high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, about 85 mg cholesterol per 100g, typical for red meat.
